settings.text: Immunosuppressant Elidel (pimecrolimus) is used. To improve your skin condition, it works by impairing your immune system, which is your body's defense mechanism.Elidel is used to treat eczema (atopic dermatitis) symptoms.Additionally, Elidel may be used for other conditions not covered in this medication guide. This article can be used by Welzo users as reference material to learn more about Elidel.

Elidel has a variety of potential health advantages.

lessen inflammatory

reduce immune function

Manage eczema

restrict the development of specific cancer cell types

Most people generally consider Elidel to be safe. The application site may experience side effects like burning, stinging, itching, and redness. It may also result in nausea, diarrhoea, and headaches. Speak to your doctor or pharmacist if these side effects are bothersome or persistent.

Elidel has been linked to a few uncommon but serious side effects, including:

Cataracts

skin maladies

Simplex herpes

allergic reactions that are severe

Elidel shouldn't be applied to skin that is broken or inflamed. People who are allergic to Elidel or any of its ingredients should also stay away from it.

Elidel is offered as an ointment and cream. Two or three times a day, it is applied to the skin's surface in the affected area.

The dose that is suggested for adults and kids older than 2 years old is:

Apply a thin layer of Elidel two times daily to mild eczema.

Apply a thin layer of Elidel three times daily to moderate eczema.

Apply a thin layer of Elidel four times per day to extremely itchy skin.

Consult your doctor if your symptoms don't go away after six weeks of treatment. They might suggest a different course of action.

Elidel functions by preventing the development of specific immune cells involved in inflammation.By doing this, it aids in easing eczema symptoms and inflammation.Elidel may also have anti-tumor properties and may aid in slowing the development of particular cancer cell types.

Your current prescriptions or dietary supplements may interact with Elidel. Your doctor needs to carefully monitor all of your medications to prevent interactions. Even if they are natural, make sure to let them know about all of the medications and supplements you use. This includes medicines prescribed by other doctors as well as vitamins, minerals, herbs, and supplements. Without first consulting your doctor, never stop taking a medication.

Both the cream and the ointment for Elidel come in generic form.
Elimination half-life for elidel is between 12 and 18 hours, and it is quickly absorbed through the skin.It is broken down in the liver and eliminated through the urine.
